### Device Lifecycle Management Program
#### Government of Canada Tender Announcement

* **Contract Reference**: MX-43056439301
* **Solicitation Number**: DCC-IT-029_RFP_DP
* **Publication Date**: 2024-03-06
* **Closing Date and Time**: 2024-05-01T14:00:00

---

**Background and Overview**
Defence Construction Canada (DCC) invites Service Providers to submit proposals to provide computing devices and peripherals, as well as device lifecycle management services to various locations across Canada. The program aims to deliver reliable, secure, and efficient device lifecycle management, including planning, deployment, asset management, and decommissioning.

**Objective and Requirements**
The objective of this Request for Proposal (RFP) is to select a Service Provider with the highest total score, based on established evaluation criteria. The selected Service Provider will be awarded a contract for an initial period of four years, with an optional extension of one additional four-year period.

**Commercial and Security Requirements**
This solicitation is being conducted in accordance with the requirements set out in the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA), Chapter Nineteen of the Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA), and the World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO-GPA). The selected Service Provider must hold a valid Designated Organization Screening (DOS) from the Contract Security Program (CSP) within Public Services and Procurement Canada (PSPC).

**Invitation to Participate**
Interested Service Providers are invited to submit their proposals through the MERX Electronic Bidding System by the closing date and time indicated on the system. All questions related to this solicitation must be directed to the designated point of contact, as identified in this advertisement.

**Contract Value and Award Decision**
The total contract value is inclusive of all devices and services outlined in the RFP. The evaluation process will be based on the established criteria, and the contract will be awarded to the Service Provider with the highest total score.

**Access to Solicitation Documents**
Solicitation documents, including the RFP package and the MERX Electronic Bidding System, are available on the MERX website (http://www.merx.com). Fees may apply; please see https://www.merx.com/public/pricing for more information.

**Point of Contact**
For any questions or concerns regarding this solicitation, please contact:

Keltie Léger
Defence Construction Canada
